section.title: &productnamereg; 5.0: Update Neutron Configration Data
section.para:
In &product;, the section
has been extended to include information on the Neutron external network setup - see .
In &product; 3.0, this configuration was typically set using the neutron-cloud-configure.yml playbook:
After upgrading to &product;, we recommend that you add the configuration information to the Input Model:

listitem.para: Edit the file ~/openstack/my_cloud/definition/data/neutron/neutron_config.yml to include a stanza for neutron-external-networks
listitem.screen: configuration-data: - name: NEUTRON-CONFIG services: - neutron data: neutron_provider_networks: - name: OCTAVIA-MGMT-NET provider: - network_type: vlan physical_network: physnet1 segmentation_id: 516 cidr: 172.30.1.0/24 no_gateway: True enable_dhcp: True allocation_pools: - start: 172.30.1.10 end: 172.30.1.250 host_routes: # route to MANAGEMENT-NET-1 - destination: 192.168.245.0/24 external: true nexthop: 172.30.1.1 neutron_external_networks: - name: ext-net cidr: 172.31.0.0/16 gateway: 172.31.0.1
cd ~/openstack/ardana/ansible git add -A git commit -m "Add config data to input model for neutron external network"

listitem.para: Run the configuration processor and ready deployment playbooks:
listitem.screen: cd ~/openstack/ardana/ansible ansible-playbook -i hosts/localhost config-processor-run.yml ansible-playbook -i hosts/localhost ready-deployment.yml
